title: Victoria - Missa O quam, etc - Westminster Chr (1983) [Philidor]
description:
Tomas Luis de Victoria was one of Spain's greatest 16th century composers of sacred music. He mastered the Franco-Flemish tradition and brought to it his own intense mysticism, and an ability to slowly increase tension through controlled rhythmic pulse. Unlike many of his French and English contemoporaries he wasn't given to elaborate counterpoint, but preferred homophony and Italianate extremes of contrast. This gives his works a theatrical quality that occasionally brings Goya's religious paintings to mind.

His masses are best known, though his motets occasionally are heard, as well. This recording features two of his best known masses.

Transfers are made at 768 kBits/s, directly from the disc.

Bio enclosed. Latin texts and translations are provided. You can find all my classical uploads by searching on Philidor, or just looking in this regularly updated thread:
  
https://pirates-forum.org/Thread-Philidor-s-uploads--63895
